doc.previous: The zeta function is closely related to prime numbers For example the aforementioned fact that there are infinitely many primes can also be seen using the zeta function if there were only finitely many primes then 1 would have a finite value However the harmonic series 1 1 2 1 3 1 4 diverges i e exceeds any given number so there must be infinitely many primes Another example of the richness of the zeta function and a glimpse of modern algebraic number theory is the following identity Basel problem due to Euler
doc.after: The reciprocal of 2 6 2 is the probability that two numbers selected at random are relatively prime 31 32
